body:
<!--*Please add a concise summary of your suggestion here.*-->
spack installed petsc cannot use the mkl_pardiso solver

### Rationale

It would be awesome to be able to use mkl_pardiso from petsc, as installed by spack

<!--*Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it!*-->

### Description

<!--*Describe the solution you'd like and the alternatives you have considered.*-->
As shown in https://gitlab.com/petsc/petsc/-/blob/master/config/examples/arch-ci-linux-intel-mkl-single.py, it should be possible to configure petsc to use mkl_pardiso



### General information

- [ ] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate



<!--If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack!
-->
title: Enable spack install petsc +mkl_pardiso
